item.title: Volume Rendered ReSTIR in Vulkan
item.author: shineyruan@gmail.com (Zhihao Ruan)
item.description: This is a project of a Vulkan implementation of Fast Volume Rendering with Spatiotemporal Reservoir Resampling. It achieves the following: Vulkan ray tracing pipeline with nvpro and Vulkan Ray Tracing KHR extension. Volume assets loading and rendering through OpenVDB. ReSTIR algorithm rendering on GLTF scene and volume assets. Authors Zhihao Ruan (ruanzh@seas.upenn.edu), Shubham Sharma (sshubh@seas.upenn.edu), Raymond Yang (rayyang@seas.upenn.edu) Tested on: Windows 10 Home 21H1 Build 19043.1288, Ryzen 7 3700X @ 3.

item.title: Vulkan Grass Rendering
item.author: shineyruan@gmail.com (Zhihao Ruan)
item.description: Tested on: Windows 10 Home 21H1 Build 19043.1288, Ryzen 7 3700X @ 3.59GHz 48GB, RTX 2060 Super 8GB Highlights This project implements physically-based grass rendering & culling with Vulkan compute shaders: Physically-based real-time rendering of grass blades; 3 different culling tests: orientation culling, view-frustum culling, distance culling; Tessellating Bezier curves into grass blades with GLSL tessellation shader A detailed instruction of this project can be found here. Vulkan Vulkan is considered as the next-generation graphics API developed by Khronos group, in replacement for the old OpenGL.

item.title: Minecraft Game Programming
item.author: shineyruan@gmail.com (Zhihao Ruan)
item.description: In the fall of 2020, I finally had a chance to explore the field of computer graphics at University of Pennsylvania, and did a very interesting course project which builds a simplified Minecraft from scratch. This game is built on OpenGL 3.2 with Qt 5.15.0. Through building this game, I learned a lot about OpenGL rendering pipeline, game engine & texture mapping. Demo Video Overview Minecraft is originally well-known for its block-like structure.
